User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments-some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PositionType
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - ...

### Classes:
1. Employee
   - Attributes:
     - id: int
     - name: string
     - position: string
   
2. Player
   - Attributes:
     - id: int
     - name: string
     - position: PositionType
     - attributes: List<Attribute>

3. ScoutingAssignment
   - Attributes:
     - id: int
     - scout: Employee
     - player: Player
     - scoutingReport: ScoutingReport

4. ScoutingReport
   - Attributes:
     - pros: string
     - cons: string
     - recommendation: string

5. ScoutingRound
   - Attributes:
     - id: int
     - players: List<Player>
     - completed: boolean

6. ShortList
   - Attributes:
     - players: List<Player>

7. Offer
   - Attributes:
     - player: Player
     - director: Employee

### Attributes:
1. Employee
   - id: int
   - name: string
   - position: string
   
2. Player
   - id: int
   - name: string
   - position: PositionType
   - attributes: List<Attribute>

3. ScoutingAssignment
   - id: int
   - scout: Employee
   - player: Player
   - scoutingReport: ScoutingReport

4. ScoutingReport
   - pros: string
   - cons: string
   - recommendation: string

5. ScoutingRound
   - id: int
   - players: List<Player>
   - completed: boolean

6. ShortList
   - players: List<Player>

7. Offer
   - player: Player
   - director: Employee

User:List all the classes and enumerations using format:
Enumerations:
1.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
2.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
...
Classes:
1.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
2.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
...

AI:Enumerations:
1. PositionType (GK, LB, ...): Represents the various positions a player can have in team sports.

Classes:
1. Employee(id: int, name: string, position: string): Represents an employee of the club involved in the scouting system.
2. Player(id: int, name: string, position: PositionType, attributes: List<Attribute>): Represents a player with associated attributes in the scouting system.
3. ScoutingAssignment(id: int, scout: Employee, player: Player, scoutingReport: ScoutingReport): Represents a scouting assignment performed by a scout for a player.
4. ScoutingReport(pros: string, cons: string, recommendation: string): Represents a report on a player generated by a scout.
5. ScoutingRound(id: int, players: List<Player>, completed: boolean): Represents a round of scouting for multiple players.
6. ShortList(players: List<Player>): Represents a list of short-listed players in the scouting system.
7. Offer(player: Player, director: Employee): Represents an offer made by the director for a player.

#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. AI:## Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, CB, RB, CDM, CM, CAM, LW, RW, ST)
2. PlayerRecommendation (Key Player, First Team Player, Reserve Team Player, Prospective Player, Not a Good Signing)

## Classes:
1. Employee
   - Attributes: id, name, role

2. PlayerAttribute
   - Attributes: name, value

3. PlayerProfile
   - Attributes: designatedPositions (List of PlayerPosition), attributes (List of PlayerAttribute)

4. ScoutingAssignment
   - Attributes: scout, player, status

5. ScoutingReport
   - Attributes: scout, player, pros, cons, recommendation

6. ShortList
   - Attributes: playerProfiles (List of PlayerProfile)

7. ScoutingRound
   - Attributes: shortList, assignedScout, completed

8. Director
   - Attributes: id, name

## Attributes:
- Employee: id (int), name (String), role (String)
- PlayerAttribute: name (String), value (String)
- PlayerProfile: designatedPositions (List of PlayerPosition), attributes (List of PlayerAttribute)
- ScoutingAssignment: scout (Employee), player (PlayerProfile), status (String)
- ScoutingReport: scout (Employee), player (PlayerProfile), pros (String), cons (String), recommendation (PlayerRecommendation)
- ShortList: playerProfiles (List of PlayerProfile)
- ScoutingRound: shortList (ShortList), assignedScout (Employee), completed (boolean)
- Director: id (int), name (String)

AI:Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, CB, RB, CDM, CM, CAM, LW, RW, ST): Represents the various designated player positions for scouting purposes.
2. PlayerRecommendation (Key Player, First Team Player, Reserve Team Player, Prospective Player, Not a Good Signing): Represents the different recommendations for players based on scouting reports.

Classes:
1. Employee(id: int, name: String, role: String): Represents an employee of the club with an identifier, name, and role.
2. PlayerAttribute(name: String, value: String): Represents an attribute of a player with a name and value.
3. PlayerProfile(designatedPositions: List of PlayerPosition, attributes: List of PlayerAttribute): Represents a player profile with designated positions and attributes.
4. ScoutingAssignment(scout: Employee, player: PlayerProfile, status: String): Represents a scouting assignment with a scout, player, and status.
5. ScoutingReport(scout: Employee, player: PlayerProfile, pros: String, cons: String, recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents a scouting report with pros, cons, and a recommendation.
6. ShortList(playerProfiles: List of PlayerProfile): Represents a shortlist of player profiles.
7. ScoutingRound(shortList: ShortList, assignedScout: Employee, completed: boolean): Represents a round of scouting with a shortlist, assigned scout, and completion status.
8. Director(id: int, name: String): Represents the director of the club with an identifier and name.

AI:Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition(GK, LB, ...):Represents the different designated target positions for a player in the system.
2. Recommendation(Key Player, First Team Player, ...):Outcomes of player evaluation used to make decisions in the system.

Classes:
1. Employee(Role: string, Name: string):Represents various employees of the club with their roles and names in the system.
2. Player(Name: string, Position: PlayerPosition, OtherAttributes: List<Attribute>):Represents a player with their attributes and designated position in the system.
3. ScoutingAssignment(TargetPlayer: Player, TeamMember: Employee):Assigns a player for scouting to a team member in the system.
4. ScoutingReport(PlayerPros: string, PlayerCons: string, RecommendedAction: Recommendation):Contains scouting report information including player pros, cons, and recommendations in the system.
5. ShortList(Players: List<Player>):Contains a list of short-listed players in the system.
6. ScoutingRound(ShortListedPlayer: Player, Scout: Employee):Represents a round of scouting carried out by a scout on a short-listed player in the system.
7. OfficialOffer(Player: Player, Director: Employee):Represents an official offer made by the director for a player in the system.

Classes:

3. Scout(name: String, longList: List of Player, scoutingReport: ScoutingReport): Represents a scout who maintains a long list of players and submits scouting reports.
4. Player(name: String, position: PlayerPosition, attributes: List of PlayerAttribute): Represents a player being scouted with a name, position, and attributes.
5. ScoutingAssignment(scout: Scout, player: Player, scoutingRounds: List of ScoutingRound): Represents an assignment given to a scout to scout a specific player.
6. ScoutingRound(scout: Scout, player: Player, pros: String, cons: String, recommendation: String): Represents a round of scouting for a player with pros, cons, and a recommendation.
7. Director(name: String): Represents the director of the club.

Classes:
1. Employee(Role: string): Represents an employee with a specific role within the club.
2. HeadCoach(DesignatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerPosition>): Represents the head coach with designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Director: Represents the director of the club.
4. Scout(LongList: List<Player>, ScoutingAssignment: ScoutingAssignment, ScoutingReport: string): Represents a scout with a long list of players, scouting assignments, and scouting reports.
5. HeadScout(ShortList: List<Player>, ScoutingAssignment: ScoutingAssignment): Represents the head scout with a shortlist of players and scouting assignments.
6. Player(Name: string, Position: PlayerPosition, Attributes: List<PlayerAttributeValue>): Represents a player with a name, position, and attributes.
7. ScoutingAssignment(Player: Player, ScoutingRound: int, Scout: Scout): Represents a scouting assignment with a player, round, and scout.
8. Director: Represents the director of the club with the ability to make official offers for players.

#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments-some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player.

   - GK

### Associations:
- Head Coach (Employee) identifies designated player profiles for future signings.
- Scouts (Employee) note players who match designated target profiles and submit scouting reports.
- Head Scout evaluates long list of players and sets up scouting assignments.
- Head Scout and Head Coach decide on players to move to the short list.
- Head Scout can carry out scouting assignments for short-listed players.
- Director (Employee) makes official offer for players recommended by the head scout.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition(GK, LB, CB, RB, CM, LM, RM, ST):Used to specify different player positions for scouting purposes.

2. PlayerRecommendation(Key Player, First Team Player, Reserve Team Player, Prospective Player, Not a Good Signing):Represents the various recommendations that can be given for a player based on scouting reports.

### Classes:
1. Employee(Name: String, Role: String):Represents an employee of the club with a name and role.

2. Player(Name: String, Position: PlayerPosition, Attributes: List<Attribute>):Represents a player with a name, position, and additional attributes.

3. Attribute(Name: String, Value: String):Represents an attribute with a name and value associated with a player.

4. ScoutingAssignment(Player: Player, Scout: Employee, CompletionDate: Date):Represents a scouting assignment with a player to scout, assigned scout, and completion date.

5. ScoutingReport(Player: Player, Pros: String, Cons: String, Recommendation: PlayerRecommendation):Represents a scouting report for a player with pros, cons, and a recommendation.

6. ShortList(Player: Player, RoundNumber: int):Represents a short-listed player with the round number of scouting.

7. Director(Name: String, Role: String):Represents the director of the club with a name and role.

User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments-some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player.

Classes:

2. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: List<TargetPosition>): Represents the head coach who identifies player profiles for signings.
3. Director(): Represents the director who makes official offers for signed players.
4. Scout(longList: List<Player>, scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>): Represents a scout who maintains long lists and scouting assignments.

6. ScoutingAssignment(scout: Scout, player: Player, scoutingResults: List<ScoutingRound>): Represents a scouting assignment with the scout, player, and results.
7. ShortList(players: List<Player>): Represents the shortlisted players for further evaluation.
8. ScoutingRound(player: Player, scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>): Represents a round of scouting for a player with multiple assignments.

10. OfficialOffer (player: Player): Represents an official offer made for a player.
